      • safeArrayMerge

        public static <T> T[] safeArrayMerge(T[] first,
                                     T[] second,
                                     T[] template)
        Merge 2 arrays. This will remove duplicates.
        Parameters:
        first - the first array to be merged
        second - the second array to be merged
        template - the array to use as a template for merging the arrays into one
        Returns:
        array containing all elements of the given 2 arrays, minus duplicate entries

      • stringToNull

        public static java.lang.String stringToNull(java.lang.String str)
        If the given string is "null" or null, this method returns null, otherwise it will return the string as it was passed
        Parameters:
        str - the String to parse
        Returns:
        null if the String is null or is equal to "null"; the String value otherwise

      • floorToBlock

        public static int floorToBlock(double num)
        Round a entity ordinate to a valid block location component This takes into account the rounding issues in negative x/z direction
        Parameters:
        num - the double value to round to the nearest lower integer
        Returns:
        the rounded number

      • parseWorld

        public static World parseWorld(java.lang.String world)
        Parses a fully qualified world name as generated by World.getFqName() to a World object. Also parses fully qualified world names with WorldName:DimensionType If only the world group name is given (that's "default" by default), then the NORMAL dimension will be assumed.

        Will not auto load the world if not loaded

        Parameters:
        world - the fully qualified world name or a world group name.
        Returns:
        the world that was parsed or null if the world didn't exist or wasn't loaded.

      • parseWorld

        public static World parseWorld(java.lang.String world,
                               boolean autoLoad)
        Parses a fully qualified world name as generated by World.getFqName() to a World object. Also parses fully qualified world names with WorldName:DimensionType If only the world group name is given (that's "default" by default), then the NORMAL dimension will be assumed.

        Will auto load the world if autoLoad is true

        Parameters:
        world - the fully qualified world name or a world group name.
        autoLoad - Will auto load the world if true
        Returns:
        the world that was parsed or null if the world didn't exist or wasn't loaded.

      • parseWorldName

        public static java.lang.String parseWorldName(java.lang.String world)
        Takes World and turns it into World_Normal Takes World:NORMAL and turns it into World_NORMAL
        Parameters:
        world - The FQ name, main world name, or the FQ name with : and not _
        Returns:
        The right FQ name

      • parseWorldName

        public static java.lang.String parseWorldName(java.lang.String world,
                                              DimensionType dimension)
        Gets the FQ world name for the base world and DimensionType Takes World and turns it into World_Normal
        Parameters:
        world - main world's name
        dimension - The dimension, can be null
        Returns:
        The right FQ name

      • parseTime

        public static long parseTime(long time,
                             java.lang.String timeUnit)
        Parse number of seconds for the given time and TimeUnit String
        Example: long 1 String HOUR will give you number of seconds in 1 hour.
        This is used to work with Unix timestamps.
        Parameters:
        time - the long time
        timeUnit - MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS, WEEKS, MONTHS
        Returns:
        long parsed time

      • parseTimeInMillis

        public static long parseTimeInMillis(long time,
                                     java.lang.String timeUnit)
        Parse number of milliseconds for the given time and TimeUnit String
        Example: long 1 String HOUR will give you number of seconds in 1 hour.
        This is used to work with Unix timestamps.
        Parameters:
        time - the long time
        timeUnit - MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS, WEEKS, MONTHS
        Returns:
        long parsed time

      • parseTime

        public static long parseTime(long time,
                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Parse number of seconds for the given time and TimeUnit
        Example: long 1 String TimeUnit.HOURS will give you number of seconds in 1 hour.
        This is used to work with unix timestamps.
        Parameters:
        time - the long time
        unit - the TimeUnit to use for conversion
        Returns:
        long parsed time

      • getTimeUntil

                                            long delay)
        Gets a readable string for the days/hours/minutes/seconds until a period of time
        Parameters:
        time - the Unix-TimeStamp to start from
        delay - the delay from the start point until expiration
        Returns:
        the String representation of the time until

      • getTimeUntil

        public static java.lang.String getTimeUntil(long time)
        Gets a readable string for the days/hours/minutes/seconds until a period of time
        Parameters:
        time - the Unix-TimeStamp of (or amount of seconds until) the future time expiration
        Returns:
        the String representation of the time until

      • worldTicksToCalendar

        public static java.util.Calendar worldTicksToCalendar(long ticks)
        Generates a Calendar(GMT, English) object representing the current time of day from the time of a world. This time can be retrieved from World.getRelativeTime(). Year, month and day values may be odd as those are not contained within the range of the world tick times in Minecraft.
        Parameters:
        ticks - the relative time of a world
        Returns:
        Calendar object representing the world time as real date

      • worldTimeTo24hClock

        public static java.lang.String worldTimeTo24hClock(long ticks)
        Converts World relative time into a 24 hour clock format
        Parameters:
        ticks - the current time of a world, retrieved by World.getRelativeTime()
        Returns:
        24 hour clock formatted string of the time

      • worldTimeTo12hClock

        public static java.lang.String worldTimeTo12hClock(long ticks)
        Converts World relative time into a 12 hour clock format
        Parameters:
        ticks - the current time of a world, retrieved by World.getRelativeTime()
        Returns:
        12 hour clock formatted string of the time

      • levelToExperience

        public static int levelToExperience(int level)
        Calculate experience points from the given level, The returned value can be passed to Player.set/remove/addExperience.
        Parameters:
        level - the level you want to get the Experience points for
        Returns:
        the amount of experience points for the given level
